arcade.env.loc

Interface Location

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HexLocation, RectLocation

    public interface Location
extends java.io.Serializable
    A Location object defines agent coordinates within the environment.

    Each agent has a Location that identifies where they are within the Grid (relative to other agents) and the Lattice (local molecule concentrations). The term location is used for Grid while the term position is used for Lattice.

    There may be multiple positions within the same location (therefore there may be more than one agent per location, but there should only be one agent per location/position pair). For example, in the hexagonal grid, each hexagon is a location. Within each hexagon there are six corresponding triangular lattice positions. There may be multiple agents in a given hexagon, but each cell within that hexagon is associated with a specific unique triangular position. Therefore, there can be no more than six agents per hexagonal location.

    Regardless of geometry, the center of the model (both in the XY and Z directions) should have Grid location coordinate (0,0,0) or (0,0,0,0). Lattice arrays cannot have negative indices, so (0,0,0) is located at the top left of the 2D array and the bottom layer of the 3D stack.

    Since:
    2.2
    Version:
    2.3.1
